active_projects.description: Complete Phase 4 from implementation-003.md for task 816. The current single-history construction in Completeness.lean trivializes modal operators (making Box φ ≡ φ), which validates invalid principles as warned in research-013.md. Replace fdsm_from_closure_mcs with proper multi-history saturated construction: (1) Define saturation_step to add witness histories for unsatisfied Diamond formulas, (2) Define saturated_histories as fixed point, (3) Prove termination via 2^closureSize bound, (4) Prove modal_saturated property at fixed point, (5) Derive modal_backward from saturation contrapositive. Files: Theories/Bimodal/Metalogic/FDSM/ModalSaturation.lean (continue Phase 4 section starting line 287).

Update .claude/context/ files based on NOTE: tag in 02-ConstitutiveFoundation.tex:357. Research notation conventions for verum/falsum in /home/benjamin/Philosophy/Papers/IdentityAboutness/IdentityAboutness.tex (lines 106, 109, 494). Since \top and \bot are not interdefinable in bilateral semantics, establish consistent terminology: reserve 'verium' and 'top' for the two top elements, 'falsum' and 'bot' for the two bottom elements. Define \ver as \neg\bot (verum) and \fal as \neg\top (falsum). Update LaTeX notation files and context documentation to match conventions from IdentityAboutness.tex.

artifacts.summary: Research report with notation conventions, four-element structure analysis, and implementation recommendations for logos-notation.sty and context documentation

active_projects.description: Address remaining FIX: and NOTE: tags in Theories/Logos/latex/subfiles/02-ConstitutiveFoundation.tex. Tags: (1) line 181: Make state modality definitions use dependent type theory notation consistently; (2) line 245: Add exclusivity constraint from counterfactual_worlds.tex:861, generalizing to n-place functions; (3) line 246: Add exhaustivity constraint from counterfactual_worlds.tex:861, generalizing to n-place functions; (4) line 357: Apply verum/falsum notation conventions established in task 823. Remove all tags after implementing fixes.

Take stock of the metalogic following major completeness strategy changes (task 812, sorries removed via 814-816). Archive obsolete elements to boneyard. Refactor Bimodal/Metalogic/ modules for clean, maintainable structure with clear dependencies. Highlight main results: soundness, representation, completeness, compactness, decidability. Rename theorems/functions for clarity. Refactor proofs, APIs, imports as needed. Maintain Algebraic/ as foundation for future algebraic representation theorem.

Resolve 3 temporal/modal sorries by adding backward coherence conditions to IndexedMCSFamily and implementing modal saturation for singleFamilyBMCS. Sorries: TruthLemma.lean:156 (phi_at_all_future_implies_mcs_all_future - requires omega-saturation), TruthLemma.lean:166 (phi_at_all_past_implies_mcs_all_past - requires omega-saturation), Construction.lean:220 (modal_backward in singleFamilyBMCS - phi in MCS implies Box phi in MCS). Strategy: Add backward_from_all_future and backward_from_all_past fields to IndexedMCSFamily; for modal_backward, options include modal saturation during MCS construction, proving from S5 properties, or multi-family approach. Dependency: Task 814 (classical infrastructure) is helpful.

artifacts.summary: Comprehensive analysis of omega-rule limitation for temporal sorries and modal saturation requirements, with three implementation strategies evaluated
Follow-up analysis showing temporal/modal sorries have different root causes; multi-family resolves only modal sorry; recommends accepting temporal sorries as axioms
Deep analysis of whether sorry-free truth lemma is achievable via hybrid strategy, with detailed examination of omega-rule, witness extraction, and construction approaches
Deep analysis of Strategy B+C combination showing temporal saturation faces fundamental circularity that multi-family construction cannot address
Publication best practices research recommending forward-direction-only Truth Lemma to eliminate sorries; Mathlib/AFP have strict no-sorry policies
7-phase plan to restructure Truth Lemma as forward-direction-only (sorry-free)
Detailed analysis of proof structure constraints and implementation outcome
Comprehensive analysis of alternative proof techniques for overcoming forward/backward interdependence, evaluating 5 approaches with feasibility assessment

Comprehensive synthesis of all prior research identifying Path 1 (Accept Current State) as the best strategy - completeness theorems are already sorry-free since they only use forward direction of truth lemma
Resolves apparent conflict between research-006 and research-007 regarding sorry-free completeness
Hybrid BoundedBMCS architecture combining FMP bounded time with BMCS multi-family saturation to eliminate temporal sorries
Analysis concluding FMP already provides sorry-free completeness; BoundedBMCS unnecessary
Historical analysis of FMP vs BMCS approaches, documenting why both prove completeness for different validity notions than Validity.lean
Analysis showing FMP CAN establish completeness for Validity.lean via single-history TaskFrame construction that trivializes Box quantification

Analysis of FMP-guided multi-history BMCS construction, explaining why single-history approach is architecturally unsound and proposing modal saturation as the correct path to sorry-free completeness for Validity.lean
7-phase plan for modal-saturated multi-family BMCS construction to achieve sorry-free completeness
FMP-based Finite Branching Model strategy for sorry-free completeness - corrects misconception that temporal sorries are unavoidable omega-rule limitations
6-phase FDSM implementation plan for sorry-free TM logic completeness using bounded time and modal saturation
Implementation summary documenting changes, sorry analysis, and comparison with BMCS

active_projects.completion_summary: Implemented Finite Dynamical System Model (FDSM) construction for TM bimodal logic completeness. Created 4 Lean modules establishing bounded time domain that makes temporal operators finite. Main completeness theorem stated with clear proof structure. Sorries are for closure membership bookkeeping, not fundamental logical content.

active_projects.description: Implement the .opencode system upgrade plan following specs/agent_system_upgrade_plan.md and specs/implementation_roadmap.md. This 6-week upgrade involves 4 phases: Phase 1 (Week 1): Foundation - file-based metadata exchange and state management; Phase 2 (Week 2): Workflow Ownership Migration - transfer postflight responsibilities to subagents; Phase 3 (Weeks 3-4): Meta System Builder Port - enable dynamic system extension; Phase 4 (Weeks 5-6): Forked Subagent Pattern - achieve token efficiency.
